projects.title: Dutch VAT Project
projects.description: End of 2013 Dana Netherlands’ Tax and Treasury Manager identified a possible gap in the Dutch VAT reporting – Intra-/Extrastat Reporting - that was confirmed through a Tax Audit by the Dutch Belastingdienst in February 2014. In April, I started up the BTW Reporting Improvement Project to mitigate the gap. The new way of reporting went live with the Tax Return of January 2015.

projects.title: Project Werkkostenregeling 2014
projects.description: •	After years of discussion, January 2014, new legislation for labourcost - the “Werkkostenregeling”, also just called WKR - was to be made applicable. Ultimately, this turned out to be per January 2015. In 2013, I started up the project “WKR 2014” to prepare our organization for this new legislation. The project was executed in cooperation with the HR Department and had a total lead time from February 2013 until December 2014 (due to the delay in going live with this legislation). Since January 2015 Dana Petroleum Netherlands has customized the accounting system in such a way that she can comply to the WKR.

contributors.headline: Joint Venture Accountant at Dana Petroleum Netherlands B.V.

projects.title: Stock Management and Control
projects.description: •	Up to 2012, Dana Petroleum Netherlands had a drilling campaign once every few years. As of 2012 the company planned to have annual drilling campaigns. So far, drilling stock material was stored with approximately 10 external suppliers'. Administratively, this stock was followed' by an excel spreadsheet. With annual drilling campaigns the need arose to have Dana's own warehouse to store all drilling stock material and with that, the necessity arose to implement a full, proper stock management system and procedure. It was decided to implement the Maximo stock module for this purpose and implement a Stock Business Unit in SunSystems. This project started in January 2012 and was initially lead by the Supply Chain Department. August 2012 it was ‘taken over’ by my self and executed in cooperation with Supply Chain Management, the Well Engineering & Construction Department and a C&A Joint Venture Accountant. The project was fully live in the course of 2013, including a full internal control procedure for this process.

projects.title: Invoice Scanning
projects.description: Digitalizing the working ways of invoices through scanning, digital archiving and digital Approval Workflow. Quite some efficiency was gained because invoices can be retrieved very quickly because they are scanned and stored digitally in a very recognizable way. Furthermore, because necessary approval - before invoices can be paid, is made possible by a work flow mechanism throughout the whole organization. The project started May 2012 and went live September 2012. By December 2012 this new way of working was fully embedded in the organization.

contributors.headline: Joint Venture Accountant at Dana Petroleum Netherlands B.V.

projects.title: Implement SunSystems in Dana NL organization
projects.description: Succesfull selection and implementation of the new accounting software “SunSystems”, as well as the definition and design of an interface between SunSystems and Dana’s maintenance and purchasing system Maximo. The implementation project started September 2010 and went succesfully live January 2011. Over the month January 2011, the necessary basic reporting like the Balance Sheet and the Profit & Loss Account could be generated. During 2011 SunSystems was made fully operational, the full reporting suit was built and all processes were adjusted to the new way of working.

projects.title: Transition from Petro-Canada to Dana-Petroleum
projects.description: Providing all sorts of supporting activities in 2010 (data room questions, completion statement) for the double divestment of first Petro Canada (acquired by Dana per 13.08.2010) and then Dana (acquired by KNOC per 01.10.2010).

profile_positions.description:
Finance is very important for any organisation. However, Finance is not just about figures. It is much more about what these figures tell us about the organisation and their business. The systems, processes and people, through which the figures come about, determine the quality and value for stakeholders. Managing these systems, processes and people is what I do; with knowledge, experience, insight and empathy for people and circumstances.

I’m available for 8 - 20 hours per week, on a temporary and/or part time basis, for the whole controlling pack or for projects regarding a dedicated subject, such as the implementation of an accounting-/ and reporting system, an internal control system, new legislation and optimising processes and procedures like a month end closing. 

“Finance is like a wave through an organisation; sometimes very demanding and present, sometimes supporting and modest.”

•	Actively builds strong relationships with business partners.

Special achievements

•	Decreased the partneraudit findings quite substantially: monetary findings of € 821,000 regarding expenditures 2005 to € 131,000 regarding expenditures 2008.
•	Played a key role in the SAP/MM project in NWE (NL, NO and UK) and was specifically recognized for that after a succesfull implementation.

profile_positions.description:

2.	Draw up the budgets of the separate departments with the responsible department managers and control all costs.
3.	Draw up the allocations to the plants of the costs of the Service Unit and fine tune these with the concerned Plant Controllers.
4.	Advise on the subjects of investments, head count and organisation efficiency. 
5.	Take care of an efficient and effective administrative organisation and administrative automation.

Plant Controller: Draw up business reporting and review and analyse variances and put together management information. 
• Control all cost- and goods movements. 
• Advise on the subjects of investments, including the economic evaluation, head counts and organisation efficiency. 
• Carry out cost price calculations. 
• Take care of an efficient and effective administrative organisation and administrative automation. 
• Guide indirectly the Accounting Department towards these activities.

Special assignment in this position: Project Manager for the project “Improve efficiency results FCC”. I put together a team of specialists with, next to myself to represent Control & Accounting, the Production Planner FCC, Production Manager FCC,  Logistics Planner FCC and Production Analyst FCC to analyse and improve the huge negative efficiency results (a -/- in the P&L)  in raw materials (check and adjust all Bills of Material, check measuring and reporting of production, check inventory and issuing all raw materials). The objective, better insight in use of raw materials and less negative results, was achieved.
profile_positions.title: Site Accountant/Plant Controller site Amsterdam

• In 1993 activities concerning business economics were added to this position. This was the budgeting and controllling of costs for the logistic-, infra- and technical departments (8 departments) as well as economic evaluation of (potential) investment projects for all plants and departments. 
• As of 1994 I participated in the SAP R/3 implementation projects of the Business Unit Catalysts (modules Materials Management, Production Planning en Financial Accounting en Control).
